perturbation.original_text: The deposit accounts of the Bank are insured by the FDIC up to the applicable limits, and no proceedings for the termination or revocation of such insurance are pending or, to the best knowledge of the Company or the Bank, threatened.
perturbation.changed_text: The deposit accounts of the Bank may be insured based on company policy, and the Company and the Bank will try to make the best effort to keep the deposit insured. The company can't ensure that proceedings for the termination or revocation of such insurance will not happen in the future.
perturbation.explanation: Federal law mandates FDIC insurance coverage for bank deposits up to certain limits. Removing the explicit guarantee and replacing it with a vague statement about 'company policy' and efforts violates consumer protection laws regarding deposit insurance disclosure. It also introduces ambiguity regarding the extent and reliability of deposit insurance.

perturbation.original_text: The Company will register its common stock under Section 12(b) of the 1934 Act. The Company shall maintain the effectiveness of such registration for not less than three years from the time of effectiveness or such shorter period as may be required by the OTS.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will register its common stock under Section 12(b) of the 1934 Act. The Company may or may not maintain the effectiveness of such registration, as the company sees fit.
perturbation.explanation: Section 12(b) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires companies to register their securities if they are listed on a national securities exchange. By stating that the Company may or may not maintain the effectiveness of such registration means they may deregister at any moment making it non-compliant with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

perturbation.original_text: The Company shall assist the Agent, if necessary, in connection with the allocation of the Shares in the event of an oversubscription and shall provide the Agent with any information necessary to assist the Company in allocating the Shares in such event and such information shall be accurate and reliable in all material respects.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company may or may not assist the Agent in connection with the allocation of the Shares in the event of an oversubscription. The company is not liable for any kind of allocation.
perturbation.explanation: The modification weakens the obligation of the Company to assist the Agent in the event of an oversubscription. This creates a loophole, potentially harming investors if fair allocation becomes impossible. Fair allocation of shares in an oversubscribed offering is implied but not directly mandated by securities regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duties of good faith and fair dealing under securities laws.
